```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
freq <- sample(10:100, 1) # Hz
wavelength <- sample(10:100, 1) # cm
  
ans <- signif(freq * wavelength / 100, 3) # freq (Hz)
dis <- c(freq * wavelength)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 6)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\,\\mathsf{m/s}$", signif(sc$questions, 3))
```
Question
========
A wave has a wavelength of $`r wavelength` \,\mathsf{cm}$ and a frequency of $`r freq` \,\mathsf{Hz}$.
What is its speed?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Wave speed is wavelength times frequency. Remember to convert to SI base units (metres)

$$ v = \lambda f = (`r wavelength/100` \,\mathsf{m})(`r freq` \,\mathsf{Hz}) = `r ans` \,\mathsf{m/s}$$
